body_html:
If you have parameters to train, you should write a custom layer: https://keras.io/layers/writing-your-own-keras-layers/
…
On 13 July 2017 at 00:40, Hans Gaiser ***@***.***> wrote: @fchollet <https://github.com/fchollet>, what if the non-Keras layer has a backprop function and/or trainable params? How can these be added to a Keras model? A Lambda layer would not handle the backpropagation / trainable params, correct? — You are receiving this because you were mentioned. body:
If you have parameters to train, you should write a custom layer:
https://keras.io/layers/writing-your-own-keras-layers/

On 13 July 2017 at 00:40, Hans Gaiser <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> @fchollet <https://github.com/fchollet>, what if the non-Keras layer has
> a backprop function and/or trainable params? How can these be added to a
> Keras model? A Lambda layer would not handle the backpropagation /
> trainable params, correct?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
